description.narrative:
The Africa Disability Alliance (ADA) has applied to Sida for funding a one-year extension of the on-going Africa Disability Rights Program (Jan. 2014- Dec. 2015) to December 2016 with a total budget of 5 MSEK.
The proposed extension seeks to attain the objective of the ADAR program, namely improved participation and inclusion of the rights of disabled people in Africa through a) mainstreaming disability rights at the regional level b)increased implementation of international and regional disability policy instruments, mainly the UN Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (CRPD) and the Continental Plan of Action (CoPA) c) adoption and ratification of key regional norms/instruments, particularly the Africa Disability Protocol (ADP) d) sustained advocacy for disability-inclusive SDGs. The cost extension is necessitated by delayed implementation of key program activities due to bureaucratic processes and procedures within the AU structures and organs (mainly in pushing through the adoption & ratification of ADP), continued demand from relevant AU organs and RECs for technical and capacity building support on the mainstreaming of disability rights at regional and country levels, and delayed processes of finalizing the SDGs, particularly the development of indicators.
The program’s intervention during the cost extension period focuses on key research, advocacy, technical assistance and capacity building (mainly directed at the relevant AU departments, RECs and selected Ambassadorial Countries), partnership, awareness raising, experience sharing and resource mobilization activities which are considered vital for the achievement of the program’s objectives. On-going partnerships with the African Union Peace & Security and Social Affairs Departments as well as designated champion states will be enhanced to ensure the program’s norm and standard setting, disability mainstreaming and policy implementation targets are met.
The intervention’s cost extension budget is fully covered by Sida and no program funds will be forwarded to partners. Funds will be utilized for program activities and operations managed from both the ADA Head Quarters in South Africa and its Regional Office in Addis Ababa.
The program is aimed at building alliances and strengthening partnerships to advocate for the rights of disabled people in Africa.

The three development objectives of the intervention were (i) to strengthen ADA (the Africa Disability Alliance) as a regional alliance and network with capacity to having a strong influence on disability inclusive policy making and programming at regional levels in the AU and the RECs by December 2015; (ii) multiple actors, including the AU and RECs are engaged in post-2015 discussions to support a global cross-thematic framework reflective of the disability agenda by December 2015; (iii) to improve governance and management of the ADA programmes and strategies by December 2015.
